The agreement I helped negotiate last week with Republican Leadership will ensure that the House works better for the people. Here are some of the changes I negotiated for: Ensuring that Members of Congress have at least 3 days to read a bill before it is voted on; Ensuring that any amendments offered to a bill that cut spending receive a vote; Ending proxy voting, which allows Members to stay at home and have another Member vote on their behalf; Requiring bills to focus on a single topic, instead of packaging several unrelated bills together and forcing a vote; Prohibiting Omnibus bills, which are the massive spending bills that cover all of the federal government; Taking a vote on a balanced budget amendment, a bill on term limits, and a package of border security bills.
